column.name: DWH_SOURCE_IND
column.comment: Indicator from which system the data record comes (2: Debit, 3: Credit).

column.name: MARKET_CODE
column.comment: Market to which the customer is assigned. Examples are MMC (credit customers who have a contract with VfD2), PUC (credit customers who have a contract with a partner company), MMO (prepaid customers who are directly assigned to VfD2), PUA (prepdaid customers who have a partner company) ), XMK ​​(Cross Market).

column.name: CA_MARKET_ID
column.comment: ID for the market provided by Provis in the header. 'MMO' for the MMO and MMC markets, 'PUA' for the PUA and PUC markets.

column.name: CA_ACTIVITY_CODE
column.comment: The code of the CSM activity.

column.name: CA_ACT_RSN_CODE
column.comment: The reason code to explain why activities were sent to the switch. - SPL - Split, REQ - Request, FRD - Fraud, NPY - No Payment

column.name: SYS_CREATION_DATE
column.comment: Date of creation of the data record in the operative system

column.name: SYS_UPDATE_DATE
column.comment: Date of modification of the data record in the operative system

column.name: OPERATOR_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the last user

column.name: APPLICATION_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the application that last processed the sentence

column.name: CA_ACTIVITY_DESC
column.comment: Description of the activity.

column.name: CA_ACTIVITY_RSN_DESC
column.comment: Short description of the current activity. For example, a Suspension activity can have reasons of "Collection" or "Customer Request".

column.name: CA_ACT_CHARGE_CD
column.comment: Describes the feature associated with the activity code. A valid feature code and its description can be selected from the Feature entity. The resulting feature list should satisfy the following conditions: · Only features with a Feature Group equal to the One-Time-Charge should be selected. · Only features which are found in the Charge Info entity with a Feature Revenue Code equal to the One-Time-Charge should be selected.

column.name: CA_SUSPENSION_RC_TYPE
column.comment: Indicates the type of the recurring calculation if the activity occurs. 'F' - Full RC 'R' - Reduced RC 'W'- Waived RC

column.name: CA_SUPPORT_RSN_IND
column.comment: Indicates if multiple reasons exist for the activity.

column.name: CA_AUTO_MEMO_TYPE
column.comment: Automatic memo type code for the BAN.

column.name: CA_EVENT_CODE
column.comment: The event associated with this activity. This will trigger a letter and a follow up (if applicable).

column.name: CA_PROCESS_CODE
column.comment: This field contains the code of a batch process. It is the code of a batch process that uses the current activity reason when performing the activity. This attribute enables the selection of activity reasons by batch processes.

column.name: CA_HOT_LINE_NO
column.comment: Hotline number - Phone number to which a customer is automatically connected after the activity.

column.name: CA_COLL_ACT_IND
column.comment: This indicator sets the current activity as a Collection Process activity.

column.name: CA_DLR_SPA_ELIG_IND
column.comment: Dealer Special Allowance Eligibility Indicator. This indicates whether a special eligibility allowance applies to a dealer per activity.

column.name: CA_DLR_CHBK_ELIG_IND
column.comment: Indicator for dealer chargeback eligibility

column.name: CA_DLR_CHBK_ACT_TYPE
column.comment: Dealer Chargeback Activity Type Indicator - describes the scheme of the chargeback calculation. - C - Current activity, P- Previous activity

column.name: CA_DLR_COM_HANDLING
column.comment: Describes the dealer compensation calculation per activity (i.e., take commission, chargeback commission), or if the activity does not impact the calculation. N

column.name: CA_BAN_MEMO_TYPE
column.comment: A type of memo that is generated automatically in order to record a BAN level activity.

column.name: CA_SWITCH_RSN_CD
column.comment: The reason code to explain why activities were sent to the switch. - SPL - Split, REQ - Request, FRD - Fraud, NPY - No Payment

column.name: CA_HOT_LINE_TYPE
column.comment: This field is relevant only for suspension. It determines whether the suspension reason is valid for hotline, pause, or  regular suspension.  - Not hotlined H - Hotline P - Pause

column.name: CA_AUTO_RES_IND
column.comment: Relevant only  for Suspend. Indicates whether the suspended subscriber will be restored automatically once he/she is out of collection. (i.e., a subscriber that was suspended for some reason will be automatically restored if  this indicator is set).

column.name: CA_CHARGE_RES_IND
column.comment: Indicator for charge resore

column.name: CA_ACTIVITY_GROUP
column.comment: This field groups the BAN cancellation reasons. It is used in the collection process to find the collection category of the BAN.

column.name: CA_FUTURE_RUN_STEP
column.comment: Whenever this activity is scheduled as a future transaction, this attribute dictates if the activity will be scheduled in the first or second run of the process. - L - Late night run, E - Early morning run

column.name: CA_CONDITION_TYPE
column.comment: Defines activities / actions which are allowed / performed in certain conditions. - A - Active cancellation, P - Passive Cancellation, D - Different custtomers, S - Same customer

column.name: CA_RSN_CATEGORY
column.comment: Groups the activities/reason codes by category. - P - porting, M - Migration (Credit to Debit/Debit to Credit), B - become D2

column.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: effective change date

column.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
column.comment: Expiry Date
